title: Fonts not working in Ubuntu 18
content: I'm having trouble with fonts in Ubuntu 18. Firefox sometimes works correctly, but sometimes it seems like it can't render some of the fonts on the page. I have even seen Google search results page broken. As you can see in the screenshot, Firefox developer tools don't work correctly either. I have not seen this behavior in other browsers on this same computer.
creator: mike331

title: Firefox crashing
content:
A few weeks ago Firefox 82.0.2 (64bit) became hellishly sluggish, and then a few days ago, began crashing. I did everything suggested on the Mozilla Troubleshoot list (e.g., Update, Start in Safe Mode, Virus & Malware check, hardware check, Refresh Firefox, etc) but it is still occurring--to the point I'm now compelled to use an alternative browser. However, I'd PREFER to use Firefox.

My only option as I see it is to Uninstall and Reinstall. Am I missing an easier/cleaner fix? Is a Reinstallation likely to fix the issue, or is there something else happening?

Cheers A
creator: alizians

title: e10s is making using my computer a nightmare
content: I have win 7, 64 bit, FF version 82.0.2. My computer is on the older side, but with ram upgrade to 8 gigs and a new larger hard drive I got it running nicely. Then along came e10s, and, well, now it's a nightmare. The sluggishness is frustrating to say the least, especially when I play my favorite on line game. I used to be able to apply all the fixes out there and remedy the situation, but now nothing works anymore to disable e10s, or is there a way still? The latest remedy, from about a year ago, was to set an environment variable, and some folks reported this working for them, but not so for me. I always make sure not to have a bunch of stuff running in the background, nor do I have a bunch of add-ons and such. Simple, bare bones...Can someone out there help please?
creator: cjohnson57

title: google to yahoo
content:
WHEN I OPEN UP FIREFOX I GO STRAIGHT TO GOOGLE AND NEVER HAD A PROBLEM UNTIL ABOUT A WEEK AGO. NOW WHEN I GOOGLE SOMETHING IT BRINGS ME TO YAHOO AND I HATE IT! title: Gmail won't load
content: Gmail will not load in Firefox, but will in Chrome. I've cleared my history, cookies, and cache. I made sure I had the latest Firefox update, restarted my computer, checked in internet connection, everything I could think of. There is no error message; it just stops loading and the page is totally blank, as you can see on the attached image. I've run out of ideas and know-how. Anyone else had this issue and resolved it?

title: Addon to save "session" Cache
content:
Is there an add-on that will allow me to save cache data to a different location for a browsing session?

Here's what I'm thinking of. I start Firefox or it's already running. I go to the Tools menu or someplace similar, and click something. After that click, the add-on now will either save or copy what would be in the cache to another location till either I turn if off or I close Firefox.
creator: billtest002

title: Website causing problem in Firefox
content:
Hi, There's a Scottish newspaper website that has started causing Firefox problems. When you click on one of the articles, the page half loads then Firefox pops up a yellow bar at the top that says - "A web page is slowing down your browser. What would you like to do. Stop it. Wait."

If I click wait, the pop up comes back. If I stop it, the page doesn't load fully. This happens every single time, it's not intermittent and it's not happening with that website on any of the other browsers I have - MS Edge, Chrome, Opera. No other website I use causes this in Firefox.

The website is https://www.heraldscotland.com
creator: Jota64

title: Extensões sumiram da barra de ferramenta
content:
Olá!

Estou tendo problemas para personalizar o navegador firefox. Minhas extensões sumiram da barra de ferramenta e não consigo restaurá-las pois não aparecem em "Personalizar Firefox" pra mim poder arrastá-las para a barra de ferramentas. Tenho uma extensão chamada FVD Downloader para baixar videos da internet que só é possível usá-la se ela aparecer na barra de ferramentas, o mesmo também para o Adblock. Não é problema com extensões desatualizadas e sim do firefox. Deve ter acontecido com as últimas atualizações do firefox. Preciso que seja consertado esse problema.
creator: thiago_fo28
